title: Solid, liquid, gas and … plasma? - Michael Murillo

multiple-choice.question: What is plasma?

options.label: A
options.text: A state of matter drastically different from solids, liquids, and gases.

options.label: B
options.text: A type of gas that can be compressed.

options.label: C
options.text: A type of liquid that can be heated.

options.label: D
options.text: A type of solid that can be melted.

multiple-choice.question: What is the main difference between plasma and other types of matter?

options.text: Plasma is denser than other types of matter.

options.label: B
options.text: Plasma is less dense than other types of matter.

options.label: C
options.text: Plasma has freely roaming negative and positive charges.

options.label: D
options.text: Plasma is made up of only positively charged ions.

multiple-choice.question: What happens when a plasma is placed in an electric or magnetic field?

options.label: C
options.text: It is accelerated and steered in circular orbits.

options.label: D
options.text: It is attracted to the field.

multiple-choice.question: What is a common application of plasma technology?

options.label: C
options.text: To destroy or alter targeted chemicals and kill pathogenic organisms.

multiple-choice.question: What is one potential use of plasma technology in the future?

options.label: A
options.text: To remove toxins from our air and water.

options.label: B
options.text: To provide a potentially unlimited supply of renewable clean energy.

multiple-choice.question: What is a characteristic of plasma that makes it useful for creating light?

options.label: C
options.text: The way it generates light when particles collide or are accelerated.

multiple-choice.question: What is a common application of plasma technology in electronics?

options.label: C
options.text: The presence of impurities that cause it to gain and release energy.

options.label: A

options.label: B
options.text: To increase the amount of waste.

options.label: C
